resources.string: More information can be found on here.

RIA DigiDoc is designed to comply with the WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility guidelines. This means that the RIA DigiDoc application has been developed using the principles that the application should be usable by the blind and people with visual, mobility, and strength impairments.
Accessibility can be improved by using built-in assistive tools on your smart device. You can find an overview of the main assistive tools below.

A screen reader is a program that converts the information on the screen of a smart device into a user-friendly output, for instance, into speech. In particular, it is a tool for the visually impaired.

RIA DigiDoc has been built based on the principle that all types of visual content can be converted into user-friendly output. For example, the images are accompanied by textual descriptions. Furthermore, the arrangement and order of the structural elements consider the screen readerâ€™s movement on the screen and allow the information to be consumed in a logical sequence.
The most common smart device screen readers:

If you have enough vision to read the text, you can use the built-in assistive tools to view the screen more comfortably. Assistive tools make it possible to change the size of text, the main font, and the colours of the user interface and enlarge the screen by using the screen magnifier.
Tools to adjust screen colour and text size:
Access to mobile-ID and Smart-ID service
Ask role and address info on signing
Allow app to use all file types (requires app restart)
Access to Digital Signature Validation Service SiVa
Digital Signature Validation Service SiVa SSL certificate
The project is supported by the European Regional Development Fund
Estonian ID-software is released by Information System Authority
In case of questions please contact our support via id.ee
Restart RIA DigiDoc to activate logging. https://www.id.ee/en/article/log-file-generation-in-digidoc4-client/
Choose a file to sign or validate
Choose a file to sign or validate

Signed document in PDF and DDOC format will be transmitted to the Digital Signature Validation Service SiVa to verify the validity of the digital signature. Read more information about transmitted data to Digital Signature Validation service from https://www.id.ee/en/article/data-protection-conditions-for-the-id-software-of-the-national-information-system-authority/
Container with this name already exists
File already exists in the container
You are about to remove the last file in the container, it is removed along with the container.
Could not remove signature from the container
Enter your role and address info
The limit for digital signatures per month has been reached for this IP address. https://www.id.ee/en/article/for-organisations-that-sign-large-quantities-of-documents-using-digidoc4-client/
Failed to send request. The number of unsuccessful request from this IP address has been exceeded. Please try again later.
Please check your smart device time. https://www.id.ee/en/article/ria-digidoc-error-please-check-your-smart-device-time/
Enter your mobile number and personal code to sign with mobile-ID
Make sure the control code matches the one on phone screen and enter mobile-ID PIN2 code
Your mobile-ID transaction has expired. Please try again
Mobile-ID not ready, try again later
Phone is not in coverage area
Your mobile-ID transaction has failed. Please contact your mobile network operator
Unknown error occurred when signing with mobile-ID
Something went wrong, try again later
Incorrect mobile number and/or personal code, non-Estonian mobile numbers must be prefixed with the country code
Missing mobile number and/or personal code
Unable to access mobile signing service
There was an error with Digidoc service, try again later
Mobile signing session is locked, try again later
An error occurred with the signers mobile phone
User is not a mobile-ID client
Your mobile signing certificate is revoked
Your mobile signing certificate status is unknown
Your mobile signing certificate is suspended
Your mobile signing certificate is expired
Failed to sign container. Check your mobile-ID service access settings. https://www.id.ee/en/article/for-organisations-that-sign-large-quantities-of-documents-using-digidoc4-client/
Failed to send request. Mobile-ID service has encountered technical errors. Please try again later.
Enter your personal code to sign with Smart-ID
Make sure control code matches with one in phone screen and enter Smart-ID PIN2 code
Confirm device for signing in Smart-ID application.
Your Smart-ID transaction has failed. Please check your Smart-ID application or contact Smart-ID customer support.
Error: an incorrect control code was chosen
Your Smart-ID certificate level must be qualified to sign documents in RIA DigiDoc mobile application.
RIA DigiDoc mobile application needs an upgrade. Please install new version from the mobile app store. Additional info is available ID-helpline (+372) 666 8888.
Smart-ID service has encountered technical errors. Please try again later.
Your Smart-ID transaction has expired or user account not found
Failed to sign container. Check your Smart-ID service access settings. https://www.id.ee/en/article/for-organisations-that-sign-large-quantities-of-documents-using-digidoc4-client/
Failed to send request. Smart-ID service has encountered technical errors. Please try again later.
Connect the card reader and insert your ID-card into the reader
Reader found. Insert your ID-card into the reader.
Wrong PIN2. You have %1$d attempts left.
Wrong PIN2. You have 1 attempt left until your PIN2 is blocked.
PIN2 blocked. Go to My eID to unblock it.
%1$s code must be at least %2$s digits long
This is an invalid signature or malformed digitally signed file. The signature is not valid.
The signature is technically correct, but it is based on the currently weak hash algorithm SHA-1, therefore it is not protected against forgery or alteration.

The signature is valid, but the container has a specific feature. Usually, this feature has arisen accidentally when containers were created. However, as it is not possible to edit a container without invalidating the signature, a warning is displayed.\nAdditional information: https://www.id.ee/en/article/digital-signing-and-electronic-signatures/
This e-Signature is not equivalent with handwritten signature and therefore can be used only in transactions where Qualified e-Signature is not required.

Signature status is displayed \"unknown\" if you don\'t have all validity confirmation service certificates and/or certificate authority certificates installed into your computer.\nAdditional information: https://www.id.ee/en/article/digidoc4-client-error-ocsp-responder-is-not-trusted-no-certificate-for-this-responder-in-local-certstore
Choose a file to encrypt or decrypt
Choose a file to encrypt or decrypt
File already exists in the container
You are about to remove the last file in the container, it is removed along with the container.
Enter personal code, company or registry code
Person or company does not own a valid certificate.\nIt is necessary to have a valid certificate for encryption.\nIn case of questions please contact our support via id.ee.
Connect the card reader and insert your ID-card into the reader
Reader found. Insert your ID-card into the reader.
Wrong PIN1. You have %1$d attempts left.
Wrong PIN1. You have 1 attempt left until your PIN1 is blocked.
PIN1 blocked. Go to My eID to unblock it.
Something went wrong with decryption. Please try again.
Connect the card reader and insert your ID-card into the reader.
Reader found. Insert your ID-card into the reader.
Something went wrong. Please try again.
PUK code is in your code envelope
PUK is blocked, because PUK code has been inserted 3 times incorrectly. You can not unblock the PUK code yourself.
Please visit the service center to obtain new codes.
Certificate has <c>expired</c>! %1$s cannot be used because the certificate has expired.
PIN1 is blocked, because PIN1 has been inserted 3 times incorrectly.
PIN2 is blocked, because PIN2 has been inserted 3 times incorrectly.
New PIN1 must be different from current PIN1.
PIN1 code is used for authentication.
If PIN1 is inserted incorrectly 3 times, the identification certificate will be blocked and it will be impossible to use ID-card to verify identification, until it is unblocked via the PUK code.
New PIN1 must be different from current PIN1.
PIN1 code is used for authentication.
If you have forgotten PIN1 code, but you know your PUK code, then here you can change your PIN1 with PUK code.
PUK code is written in the envelope that is given with the ID-card.
New PIN2 must be different from current PIN2.
PIN2 code is used to digitally sign documents.
If PIN2 is inserted incorrectly 3 times, the signing certificate will be blocked and it will be impossible to use ID-card for digital signatures, until it is unblocked via the PUK code.
New PIN2 must be different from current PIN2.
PIN2 code is used to digitally sign documents.
If you have forgotten PIN2 code, but you know your PUK code, then here you can change your PIN2 with PUK code.
PUK code is written in the envelope that is given with the ID-card.
PUK code is used for unblocking the certificates when PIN1 or PIN2 has been entered 3 times incorrectly.
If you forget the PUK code or the certificates remain blocked, you have to visit the service center to obtain new codes.
Current PIN1 code must be at least %1$d digits long
Current PUK code must be at least %1$d digits long
Current PIN2 code must be at least %1$d digits long
Current PUK code must be at least %1$d digits long
Current PUK code must be at least %1$d digits long
Wrong PIN1 code. You can try %1$d more times.
Wrong PUK code. You can try %1$d more times.
Wrong PIN2 code. You can try %1$d more times.
Wrong PUK code. You can try %1$d more times.
Wrong PUK code. You can try %1$d more times.
Wrong PIN1 code. You can try 1 more time.
Wrong PUK code. You can try 1 more time.
Wrong PIN2 code. You can try 1 more time.
Wrong PUK code. You can try 1 more time.
Wrong PUK code. You can try %1$d more times.
PIN1 has been blocked because PIN1 code has been entered incorrectly 3 times. Unblock to reuse PIN1.
PUK has been blocked because PUK code has been entered incorrectly 3 times. You can not unblock the PUK code yourself.
PIN2 has been blocked because PIN2 code has been entered incorrectly 3 times. Unblock to reuse PIN2.
PUK has been blocked because PUK code has been entered incorrectly 3 times. You can not unblock the PUK code yourself.
PUK has been blocked because PUK code has been entered incorrectly 3 times. You can not unblock the PUK code yourself.
New PIN1 code must be at least %1$d digits long
New PIN2 code must be at least %1$d digits long
New PUK code must be at least %1$d digits long
New PIN1 code can\'t be part of your personal code
New PIN2 code can\'t be part of your personal code
New PUK code can\'t be part of your personal code
New PIN1 code can\'t be your date of birth
New PIN2 code can\'t be your date of birth
New PUK code can\'t be your date of birth
New PIN1 code can\'t be so easy
New PIN2 code can\'t be so easy
New PUK code can\'t be so easy
Old and new PIN1 have to be different
Old and new PIN2 have to be different
Old and new PUK have to be different
Cannot add empty file to the container.
An empty file is attached to the envelope. Remove the empty file from the container to sign.
To share the container click the \"SHARE\" button and choose your preferred application. All containers can also be found in the application settings \"Recent Documents\" folder.
Application crashed. Please send us crash report, so we can fix the problem.
We\'ve detected that your device may be rooted. For security reasons we don\'t recommend using this app on a rooted device.
